items.def: Crucifixion under Pilate recorded by Tacitus and Josephus relevant because non Christian sources fix the historical core that the Gospels interpret as fulfillment
Peter's denial women as first witnesses and the disciples flight relevant because such details reduce credibility in that culture and are unlikely inventions
Casting lots and piercing in Psalm 22 and Zechariah echoed in John 19 relevant because Roman soldiers actions were beyond Christian control
Entry on a donkey fulfilling Zechariah 9:9 relevant because deliberate symbolic actions by Jesus fit known prophetic practice and point to self understanding
Formula about death burial resurrection and appearances within a few years of the events relevant because belief in fulfillment predates written Gospel narratives
Matthew's use of Hosea 11:1 and Jeremiah 31:15 relevant because Second Temple interpretive practice connects past Scripture to present events without requiring fabrication
